intro: Arabis takesimana f. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Native to mountainous regions of East Asia, this plant thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold climates. It is often found in alpine environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. The species is noted for its resilience and ability to survive in harsh, high-altitude conditions.
